TopicTitle: Awesome science mission (for me, at least! :P )! More than 2045 SP

Articles.Content:
Hi guys, I would like to share my best accomplish so far in this game. I started to play a couple of weeks ago, directly with 1.0. I wish I'd discovered this game sooner...

P.S. Sorry for my english.

Lets get started:

-BACKGROUND

Career mode (the only I've played! ). 1M in resource and about 1k of science point. At this point of the game it's a little frustrating to gain SP, on Kerbin it's a mess and it's difficult to track the advance and to plan mission. There are a lot of science "left" on the MUN, but I would like to jump to different biomes in one mission. So I choose Minimus. Less gravity, less fuel!

So I needed a lander that could jump and a module that could store experiments for bring them back to Kerbin, and a scientist that could move the data and restore the equipment.

I'M HONORED TO PRESENT YOU:

Erburry

--ROCKET

5 STAGES, to bring the 83t lander module safe on Minimus.

--THE MISSION

Landed safely on Minimus, I was able to jump to 5 different biomes, collecting 8 experiment each.

Then I deploy the MK1 with the experiment in it and left Erburry in the surface lab... it's his job, right?

In the Mk1 there was 34 experiments awaiting for a correct analysis on Kerbin.

And finally...

2045 SP!! WOHOOOO!

And hundreds were already been delivered by the antenna (EVA)

This entire mission costs 290k, but I was able to gain 317k with the "Build a new surface outpost on Minimus" mission and another 141k with the "Test structural Pylon on an escape trajectory out of Minimus" Mission, with a total gain of 168k. YEAH!!!!! :D

The next step will be gain 1M to upgrade the "Research and Development" building for spending all those points!!!!

Hope you enjoy this mission,

Mario
That's a mighty nice rocket for someone who just got the game a couple weeks ago, nice job! That's a great science haul from Minmus as well.
Thanks!! I've been waiting for a game like this for decades!!!! :D
I see you have constructed your own light sabre. Impressive .
